reviews.text: Very good breakfast first of all, good rooms, but not very big,situated in the centre.
reviews.title: good opportunity to stay in the centre of the Riga

reviews.text: Hotel Albert is a very nice and affordable business hotel located in the very centre of Riga, just a few minutes walk from the Old Town and main city attractions. The rooms are good size, clean and well equipped. The restaurant offers rich breakfast menu and decent dinner menu. On the top floor there is a Star Lounge which is nice for having a drink in the evening and offers a great view over Riga Old Town and the river (the view is especially effective by night!). I have stayed in this hotel numerous times during my business trips and never had anything to complain about.
reviews.title: Very nice & affordable business hotel in the centre of Riga

reviews.text: the rooms are clean, the peronnell friendly and competent. Variaty and quality of the brakfast was more than adequate. For a 3-star Hotel in walking distance to the old part of the capital, a fair deal.
reviews.title: good value

reviews.text: Looks can be deceiving! The hotel website looks good but it is probably the same as a hostel. The hotel offers poor customer service and be warned that your rooms may not be cleaned properly or have some of the expected items. My room had air-conditioning that didn't work, there was no indication of how to contact reception and there was no shower gel in the bathroom. When I spoke to reception downstairs the team was very dismissive and nothing changed. I later chatted to the manager and also sent an e-mail but no-one has replied.
reviews.title: not recommended

reviews.text: Lots of style but the room we had was very small, and the lack of a shower curtain or door (one of the style features no doubt) meant lots of water everywhere. The elevators are SLOWWWWWW. The staff were accomodating, the breakfast was very good with lots of selection and good quality foods. The location is a little far to walk, especially with rainy weather, but there are always taxis at the hotel. Good value for money.

reviews.text: We stayed at the Albert after it was recommended by friends and would be willing to do the same. It was very modern with a great Albert Einstein theme throughout. The rooms had fantastic touches like the 'I'm thinking' do not disturb signs and Einstein pictures and quotes in frames. If you stay at the front of the hotel you have a great view of the rooftops of Riga, realy good when its been snowing. TV also offered more english speaking channels than many European hotels I've stayed in recently.
reviews.title: Good modern hotel

The hotel is a bit off centre but you can easily walk to the city centre so no problems, Hotel itself was really new and clean, all the staff very helpfull , excellent bar on the rooftop with happy hour that made us wonder how they can make any profit from it , Breakfast buffet 1st class with huge selection of any breakfast food you can imagine.Free wireless Internet as well.We had a great stay - Well done hotel Albert!

bit out of town
reviews.text: Riga is not a huge city and hotel Albert is maybe good 15 minutes walk from the town centre. Hotel Albert is a good and clean property, with good breakfast. I paid 60 euros which was a very good price for high season. There is a nice bar on the top of the hotel. Rooms are bit small but nicely furnished. There is a taxi stand right outside hotel and its around 10 euros ride to the airport.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Albert Hotel is a new hotel set about 15-20 minutes walk from the old part of Riga. The taxi ride directly to the hotel from the airport was about 8Lat (roughly 8GBP). Having arrived on the early morning Ryanair flight from London, we were allowed to check-in to our room from about 11am – not bad at all!

reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel for three nights although did not choose it personally (accompanied my sister who was on a work trip). My first impression of the hotel wasn't great because I had booked a taxi transfer with the hotel for collection from the airport which didn't turn up, apparently because someone on reception had forgotten to book the actual taxi. They did try to rectify this by offering to cover any additional cost over the agreed price if I took a taxi from the rank but still wasn't the best start.
reviews.title: Modern hotel with a great breakfast!

reviews.text: Aside from that it was a great stay. The double room wasn't huge but decorated in a contemporary style with a very clean, modern bathroom. Noise from the road when the window was open was quite loud but the air con worked brilliantly. The restaurant a pleasure to visit and very reasonable for dinner considering that they give you silver service. Our evening meal was very good and I loved the buffet style breakfast, although it is very continental so some may not enjoy the fried potatoes and meatballs so early in the day! Be warned that the "juice" is not real juice but is squash.
reviews.title: Great modern hotel

reviews.text: Hotel is a 5-10 minute walk to the Old Town and takes you through a nice park. There's a pharmacy (Brogas) on the way which is like Boots of Superdrug in the UK and you also pass a Costa Coffee and a Double Coffee. Note: Double Coffee may look like a normal coffee shop outside but is table service and serves lots of food and alcohol. Highly recommended!
reviews.title: Cosy!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Meanwhile, the Star Lounge at the hotel is a good place to relax and the cocktails are quite decent. The views over the city are amazing too. The staff everywhere in the hotel are helpful and friendly, and reception provide a free map if you need one. They were even helpful at midnight when we came back from the exellent Cuba Cafe in the Old Town and were hungry as they were happy to order us a huge pizza to take to our room.
reviews.title: Nice hotel ideal for city break

reviews.text: I would definitely recommend this hotel especially as it feels like a "proper" hotel although it cost us the equivalent of £40 per night. Very much enjoyed my stay here.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel, great location and lovely restaurant!!!
